item.title: Adding static IPv4 in FreeBSD
item.description: This is a quick how-to guide on adding to FreeBSD machine. Set permanent IP Open /etc/rc.conf vi /etc/rc.conf Search for ifconfig_xn0 (xn0 is interface name) and edit its contents to reflect your IP. hostname="freebsd" ifconfig_xn0="inet 192.168.10.1 netmask 255.255.250.0" Run the /etc/netstart script to update configuration. ./etc/netstart Set temporary IP NOTE: IP will be reverted after reboot. Get the interface name using ifconfig -a (you don’t want lo interface) $ ifconfig -a lo0: flags=8049<UP,LOOPBACK,RUNNING,MULTICAST> metric 0 mtu 16384 .
